website_summaries.verdict: A great accessory to the guitar collector as it can hold multiple axes. Great for storing instruments in cases.
pros: Built from American hardwood to a furniture-quality standard
Can hold seven electric guitar cases with ease, or 5-6 acoustic guitar cases
Effortlessly folds down when not in use
cons: A small number of buyers say the pre-drilled holes were countersunk to the wrong side

customer_reviews.title: Very nice with one caveat.
customer_reviews.text: This comes with a tube of glue. DON'T use it. It's Gorilla glue, which should be a banned substance. Use regular wood glue or no glue at all instead. The thin line of glue you are told to use between the screw holes will expand into an ugly yellow foamy hard residue. You can clean it while it's still wet but it will continue to expand, turning a really nice product into a hideous mess.
customer_reviews.author: Gumball Popeye

customer_reviews.title: Great rack, but could use an add-on...which you can 3D-print
customer_reviews.text: I like my String Swing, but since I have mostly soft-cases, and some odd-sized stuff, I wind up with a pile of guitars over to one side. I created a 3D Printed "Separator" to keep the guitars standing up. You can find the 3D model for it it, and instructions for printing it, for free, at YouMagine.com. Search for "String Swing". If you don't have a 3D printer, you might find a local Hacker Space, or even a Public Library with a printer that can help you print. I use 5 of these.
customer_reviews.author: David Cain

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality Bought Two
customer_reviews.text: So I have a lot of guitars. And I always buy hard cases for them. They were laying upright on the floor until I got two of these. They are rock solid no worries of it breaking when assembled properly. They are holding some heavy Gorilla flight cases with big hollowbody jazz boxes no issues. The one issue I did run into is with odd shaped cases like a Flying V hard case. It wants to tip forward if you don't spend a few minutes positioning it correctly. Same with a big rectangle Explorer case. Once they're in though I don't worry about it. Recommended!! So nice to have floor space back!
customer_reviews.author: kp001nh

customer_reviews.title: Good looking guitar case stand for the money
customer_reviews.text: For the cost it seems like a bargain. It arrived in a surprisingly small carton since it is unassembled. The carton didn't have packing material around the tightly wrapped plastic stretch material. This unified bundle apparently prevents any damage to the wood. At least it did in my case. None of the wood had any damage or rubbing issues at all even though the carton had some damage. This unit assembles easily if you read the directions, which admittedly I never like to do. But there are only few steps and was easy. To sum it up, this is a good looking guitar case stand for the money. I will buy another when I need it.
customer_reviews.author: DWR

customer_reviews.title: Great quality stand.
customer_reviews.text: I jut put this together and I was very impressed with the high quality of the parts. Everything fit together very well. My only suggest is that the instructions let me put the parts together wrongly. Fortunately, I did not use the enclosed glue and I was able to quickly and easily put the rack together correctly. If you buy this, and I do recommend it, do an assembly without the glue first and then put it together with the clue. I have assembled lots of kits and this is definitely at the high end of kits. The parts are very good quality and they are very precisely cut and drilled.
customer_reviews.author: W Swift

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and well-made.
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and nice wood! This is a handy stand! I was able to fit seven smaller instruments (ukulele, mountain dulcimer, violin, etc.) on this stand. Assembly direction pictures could be a little more clear. I had a lot of difficulty seeing the base assembly using the photos and had to look back at the Amazon posting to see exactly how it should go. A note to the maker - I would love to have a stand that's not as tall to hold smaller instruments like ukuleles, psaltries, Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: romperoo

customer_reviews.title: Great Mandolin Rack!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty easy to assemble. As far as one review with the global war on Gorilla Glue just follow the instruction that state thin line. I am a mandolin lover so all instruments in the photo are mandolins with the exception of the Gretsch. Next to it is an Octave mandolin. The fat short one is a Banjo mandolin that is short and does not rest on the upper bar but the rack holds it well. I venture to guess you could put seven mandolins in hard cases in this rack! Exceptional quality!
customer_reviews.author: F Dean Williams

customer_reviews.title: Easy to construct, a joy to behold
customer_reviews.text: I am not a talented guy when it comes to putting stuff together, but this was pretty simple. And when it was together, it was a nice-looking piece of "furniture." So I think what I got for what I paid is a pretty good deal. It meant that a corner of the bedroom with several cases and gig bags could be consolidated into a nice package of guitar and banjo cases and bags. What was scattered now looks planned. Jim
customer_reviews.author: Jim in Oregon

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking and does the job
customer_reviews.text: Looks great. Was easy to assemble. Sturdy especially when you have guitars on the stand. Went with the darker wood stain and couldn’t be happier. Currently have two acoustic guitars and two electric guitars in their. All four are in there cases. Would easily hold another guitar and its case. May not fit five acoustic guitars and their cases due to the thickness of an acoustic guitar case.
customer_reviews.author: howlin at the moon

customer_reviews.title: Best guitar case holder.
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for storage of guitar cases and will hold up to 7 electric guitar cases, however acoustic guitar hardshell Cases only 5 , I'm going to be buying more of these for my guitars , you can even set up this rack on stage and it's simple to put together , you'd be hard pressed to find something else better for this price , I highly recommend getting one .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cases piled against the wall- No more!
customer_reviews.text: What is the session today.? Do I need a Pbass with flats or a 5string Stingray? All my instruments are lined against the living room wall in gig bags or cases, next to the front door. Honestly, its a bit of an eyesore. This stand organizes and cleans up a mess and the instruments are much better protected. I can still grab and go, but the crib is much neater and my wife is happier.
customer_reviews.author: J. G.

customer_reviews.title: Handsome Solution to Storage Problem
customer_reviews.text: I assembled this per the instructions in minutes. Good quality hardwood neatly sawn and drilled, stained. Looks Great! I immediately put my 4 guitars in cases on the rack, can fit one more easily (birthday is coming). This takes up less space than what I was previously doing, although the populated rack will take up approximately 3 feet by 3 feet.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Cerreto

customer_reviews.title: Simple, but exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I am using this to hold a very large acoustic guitar in case, electric guitar and electric bass in softside bags. I thought I might need to add spacers or pegs, but it works fine. One of those products no one else does as well. It’s not exciting, but it is exciting because it does what it is supposed to do and looks “furniture” enough for a spot in the living room. Took about 5 minutes to put together.
customer_reviews.author: J P

customer_reviews.title: How did I not know this was available
customer_reviews.text: I have String Swing guitar hangers for the all the guitars in my music room. The cases are a different story. They were always in the way and because they are uneven, they don't stack very well. I found this String Swing solution and decided to give it a try. It is solid oak. It looks good and is very strong. Now all of my cases set in a rack, off the ground and out of the way. I could not be happier with this rack.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Senechal

customer_reviews.title: Great Case Rack - Exceeded my expectations
customer_reviews.text: I have several guitars and mandolins. I assumed this rack would work for the guitars, but that I would have to add a board halfway down to accommodate my mandolins. I was pleasantly surprised when it work4d just as well for the mandolins!!! They should add that to their advertisement.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Tuffy

customer_reviews.title: It's Not Great.
customer_reviews.text: Overall this product should be better. It's overpriced for the quality which is insubstantially weak. For my use, it will suffice, but it holds only 4 Acoustic instrument cases. The seller did ship fast and assembly was easy. Perhaps a better quality rack would be pre-assembled. This rack should sell for about $29.00, or maybe $39.99, but no more. It's really overpriced.
customer_reviews.author: Professor Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to organize all the instruments I have collected. So after much research I decided to give this a try & was glad I did. I was a little complicated to assemble but nothing over the top. It does exactly what it’s designed to do. I really like it & it makes my music area much less cluttered.
customer_reviews.author: Karen L. Lisby

customer_reviews.title: Great way to store guitars
customer_reviews.text: We have several guitars in the house and I needed a way to store them appropriately. This product is actually able to hold 6 guitars (4 hard case and 2 soft) so it is perfect for us! It is well-made in the USA and looks nice. This is a purchase I am glad we made.
customer_reviews.author: karen

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This guitar case rack is exactly what I needed to tidy up my apartment. The color is perfect for a nice modern look and it is very sturdy. I currently have 4 guitar cases sitting nice and snug in the rack and I have no doubt that they will be safe staying there. The price is the only thing I'd have to say is a bit off for this product, but it is made in the USA and I can't say "no" to American-made goods. All-in-all, it's a very good product and worth the 5-star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Great value, great design
customer_reviews.text: Updated after 6 months. Perfect for my needs. Everything else in the category of racks for guitars in cases were well above this price point, and the minimalistic style goes well pretty much anywhere. Easy to assemble, and very happy with the quality. It's exactly what I wanted at a price that seems fair 6 month update: Still 5 stars, this thing is perfect
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Almost cheaper than parts alone.
customer_reviews.text: This stand was PERFECT for my 5 guitars. Way cheaper and nicer than anything I could build on my own and had it up in under 15 minutes. It took me longer to find my electric screwdriver bits than to build it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard DiVito

customer_reviews.title: Very well made
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to assemble. Took me 15 minutes. Finished very nicely (I bought the less expensive one), but it's still hardwood, oak, I think, and has a nice stain finish. Holes are all countersunk and everything lined-up perfectly. More than sturdy enough for the purpose. Hold at least four acoustics - I have four in their cases there now, including two dreadnaughts, and could easily put an electric guitar in there to make five.
customer_reviews.author: noaxetogrind

customer_reviews.title: Got Guitars Off the Floor
customer_reviews.text: My music room was littered with guitar cases. This rack is nice piece of furniture. It's easily assembled. Most of all, it got my guitars off the floor and made them more accessible.
customer_reviews.author: J. McNabb

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Solid Instrument Stand
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together, very sturdy, holds my guitars and solid Mandolin case. but doesn't work as built/received for Ukulele. But I knew that when purchasing, so it is great for its intended purpose!
customer_reviews.author: Sean D Lowther

customer_reviews.title: Great wood, great construction, simple to assemble and very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Great quality excellent wood and easy to assemble. And an extra bonus, Made In the USA!. The only thing missing, in my mind, to make it 100% is some padding on the base and top support boards to protect the cases. Even without the glue it’s pretty sturdy. I’ll be looking at adding some padding myself. See picture with my modification
customer_reviews.author: Bas

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and it Works!
customer_reviews.text: I was thinking of building something and came across this on Amazon. Paid $59.00 for a solution that works great, looks good and is American made!! Highly recommend if your cases are piling up. Now I can touch up all the scuff marks on the wall from before.
customer_reviews.author: Houston Texas

customer_reviews.title: Love it !
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful stained oak. Predrilled, with black woodscrews, it's simply but a nice looking rack (did I say that?). Goes together in probably 15 minutes and it's solid oak. All the guitars went in without it even budging. Incredible bargain too. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JJH New Hampshire

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Super easy and kind of fun to assemble. Feels sturdy. For me it fit 1 hard case acoustic, 1 hard case viola, 3 gig bag guitars, 1 gig bag electric uke, and I even just hung the straps of my acoustic uke bag on the end of it hanging off the side. It does take up more space than I had imagined since everything needs room to kind of sit at an angle, so the tops of the instruments go out past the dimensions of the rack (especially bass). I like many others did not use the glue.
customer_reviews.author: T G

customer_reviews.title: Clear your floor of guitar cases!
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift for my dad and he absolutely LOVES it. Holds a bunch of cases and clears up the ground where the cases use to be. Wasn’t too bad to put together. Solid purchase. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Great design, value and Made in the U.S.A.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product; easy to assemble, sturdy, made in the U.S.A. It will easily hold 6 acoustic/hollow-body guitar cases and 7 of the rectangular cases plus 1 soft case. When removing a case from the middle, the adjacent cases remain in place. I am thinking about copying the design for an open back amp stand.
customer_reviews.author: Tim H.

customer_reviews.title: Assembly is pretty straightforward. Quality of materials is excellent
customer_reviews.text: I've been amassing several acoustic guitars in recent years, so I've been looking for storage options. This stand fit the bill perfectly. Assembly is pretty straightforward. Quality of materials is excellent. It's sturdy, understated, and just works. I'm able to fit 5 Martin Geib style cases on this stand without a problem.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful craftsmanship, Made in USA!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these guitar racks to help eliminate the clutter of guitars in old school hard cases. They'll hold 5 or 6 instruments in their cases and display nicely. I also like the idea of keep the instruments in an upright position...they seem to be "happier" stored in that manner. It also gave my music room a fresh new look and feel. Totally worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Brian M

customer_reviews.title: Real wood,  quality looks, works great!
customer_reviews.text: Quality real wood guitar case rack. Looks great and assembled easily. Having a power screwdriver does make putting it together go faster. I like the first so much I bought a second. I found out it is perfect for tenor size ukulele cases also!
customer_reviews.author: Rusty

customer_reviews.title: Pay attention to the Pictures and Think about the install
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to put together but must pay attention to the front back etc, with a dry fit before doing any screwing or gluing. Nice looking, easy to move around to situate your cases where you want.
customer_reviews.author: Dwtrux

customer_reviews.title: Easily holds up to five acoustic guitars
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Easily holds up to five acoustic guitars. Was easy to put together. Two of the holes (at the back) were drilled in such a way that the wood pieces are not flush after being put together, but since it's at the back it doesn't show.
customer_reviews.author: Menunya

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband. He has six guitars resting on this item in their cases. It's been a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Moonbelly

customer_reviews.title: Well Made
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. Assembly was easy - parts were nicely milled and the holes were all correctly pre drilled. It is lightweight but solidly holds guitar cases.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Just what the gear doctor ordered!
customer_reviews.text: I have limited space and 6 guitars in cases/gig bags that need stowage. The String Swing fills the need perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Allen Bessanson

customer_reviews.title: Guitar case cleanup
customer_reviews.text: Our guitar cases were getting out of hand, and this cleaned up the situation nicely. Holds 5 -acoustic guitar cases or 7-8 electric guitar cases. Assembly took about 10 minutes with my handily electric screwdriver.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Kaplan

customer_reviews.title: Nice sturdy stand.  Easily takes 5 cases
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Sturdy. Currently holding 1 Banjitar, 3 full size guitars and 1 3/4 guitar, all in hard cases. Nice, well made product and easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: mcorkil

customer_reviews.title: absolutely worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I was blown away by the quality of the item. Solid wood, solid hardware, everything fits together tight! I would buy more, and probably will when the guitar level increases, as it always does. I HIGHLY recommend this rack. it delivers on all counts.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money. Keeps your guitars up off of the floor and safe.
customer_reviews.text: I was going to build my own, but for the price, you can’t beat the quality and design. I fit several guitars on it and it’s very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Ibanez Musician

customer_reviews.title: Nice Rack.
customer_reviews.text: Stores two acoustic guitars, three electric guitars and a banjo in their cases perfectly. Looks great!
customer_reviews.author: G-man

customer_reviews.title: Works Well.
customer_reviews.text: It is a simple rack. It fits my guitar cases. It is very nice to get all the guitar cases standing up in one place.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne V

customer_reviews.title: Nice guitar and case containment.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together. Beautiful finish on oak! Looks like fine furniture. Exactly as shown. Holds 5 guitars in their cases with a bit of room to spare. All were well pleased and surprised .
customer_reviews.author: James L.

customer_reviews.title: Just get it
customer_reviews.text: Bad ass, honestly. Looked so neat and tidy I went and redecorated half my living room. I think it says it holds 5 guitar cases.. I'm pretty sure there would be room for somewhere around 7 electric guitar cases with no space between them. Would highly reccomend
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: And it WILL hold a violin case...
customer_reviews.text: Overall, super impressed. Nice quality wood for a very reasonable price. I have a couple guitar cases and a violin case and it's not even half full.
customer_reviews.author: konjurer

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Works great for a fairly inexpensive item. We keep it in the closet and it holds 4 or 5 guitar in their cases.
customer_reviews.author: KC Cowgirl

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with it.
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I needed!!! So easy to put together and I'm a single female who hates doing this things. It looks Nice and does the job. Only thing is I can barely squeeze 5 cases in it. It's tight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Fan 2012

customer_reviews.title: As described, fit 5 instruments!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together (it took more time taking it out if the package than putting it together-it was well packaged!). I was able to fit 3 guitars in cases, 1 violin, and 1 viola (see picture)
customer_reviews.author: wheaties

customer_reviews.title: Top quality and very reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these case racks. They're very attractive, functional, solid quality, and very reasonably priced. Easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Gary T.

customer_reviews.title: My husband loves it. Sturdy and looks great
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband’s guitars. He really likes that he can keep his guitars in the cases and keep them upright. The stand was easy to put together and looks really nice. I’m ready to buy another one for the rest the f his guitars.
customer_reviews.author: DotC5

customer_reviews.title: Well made and nice looking.
customer_reviews.text: I looked all over for a Guitar Case Rack that would be sturdy and not take up much space. This rack is nice looking and holds five of my Guitars that I have in cases. I'm very satisfied with this purchase and the bonus is the price!
customer_reviews.author: Alan Manley

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, held 6 cases no problem
customer_reviews.text: I was able to get 6 cases on this including an acoustic so great value for the money and it looks fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: James R Haile

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and is used to hold 4 guitars and violin case. Could be a bit more "beefy" but other than that good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth B. Horn

customer_reviews.title: buy it because it keeps the wife sane lol
customer_reviews.text: very simple that serves its purpose for my husband to organize his guitars!
customer_reviews.author: mommythesedays

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice! Oak wood, sturdy - does the job in a small space getting guitar cases off the floor. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mo Jo

customer_reviews.title: A definite need...
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and keeps my guitars organized. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: tfowers

customer_reviews.title: You can fit up to 7 electric guitar cases.
customer_reviews.text: .Quality wood and parts. Hold most cases well A bit narrow for the triangular cases but still hold them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: The best guitar rack at this price. Made of solid wood and very sturdy. Looks nice too. I have 2 acoustics and 4 electrics on it.
customer_reviews.author: rob

customer_reviews.title: great for the money
customer_reviews.text: its plenty sturdy i have no complaints. all my cases fit on there i have 7
customer_reviews.author: robb frank

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous
customer_reviews.text: I love this rack. It freed up so much space and it looks great
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: Good for organizing instruments with cases
customer_reviews.text: Photo looks flimsy, but we have 2 loaded out and no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend for any musician
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband for Christmas. Was tired of seeing his guitars piled up in the floor. He loves it and so do I! We're going to purchase another to accommodate all his instruments. Highly recommend for any musician!
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Adkins

customer_reviews.title: Great guitar stand!!
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to assemble, I didn't use the glue so I could take it apart if I needed to and it's very sturdy even without the glue. I added 3 string swing hangers so I have 3 guitars and 3 cases on it...keeps everything so organized now...love it!!! Hardwood not cheap...great quality for a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Reyna

customer_reviews.title: If you are going to use glue on the screws, don’t usegorilla glue... ( it swells) use super glue
customer_reviews.text: I love this, my husband put it together And it is perfect!! Has 2 guitars and a Ukulele in it right now
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Corry

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Great product, nicely made. Holds 5 guitars in their cases and saves my paint from all that scuffing the cases inevitably caused leaning against the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Subaruvian

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect accessort to tame the growing pile of cases from my modest guitar collection!
customer_reviews.author: RockDad37

customer_reviews.title: Very well made. Nice wood.
customer_reviews.text: Very well made. Fits at least 5 guitar cases. Can fit 6, depending on the cases. Nice wood.
customer_reviews.author: SFCA

customer_reviews.title: Great rack for a great price
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used a lot of racks and stands over the years and this is by far my favorite. Easily holds 5 acoustics in their cases. It’s also very stylish. This is a great value. I had no problems with the assembly, which was very easy and took about 10-15 minutes. Buy with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great for violin cases as well
customer_reviews.text: Just got it. Great product quality, easy to assemble, can be used for violin cases, not only for guitar. It is free standing so not necessary to place against a wall or another support.
customer_reviews.author: Rkar

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and excellent quality wood stand
customer_reviews.text: Very solid built. Perfect kit delivery and easy assembly. Beautiful wood and serves my purpose well! A+++++++++++++++
customer_reviews.author: david mauldin

customer_reviews.title: Functional and simple
customer_reviews.text: Not much to it but exactly what it needs to be.
customer_reviews.author: JClark

customer_reviews.title: Guitar Stand - Swing String Review
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Easy to setup and currently holding 5 electrics with their cases. Have had this for about 3 months with no issue. Thinking of buying another for acoustics.
customer_reviews.author: BEngle43

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great way to store your guitar cases. Nice quality, well constructed, excellent finish on the oak.
customer_reviews.author: raymond d. frost

customer_reviews.title: Tip over point margin is too narrow for the rectangular cases
customer_reviews.text: One of the pre-drilled holes didn’t align. Also, the tip over point margin is too narrow for the rectangular cases. I don't feel comfortable using the rack for them. I'm keeping the rack as it works great for the guitar shaped cases. I wish they make the rack specifically for the rectangular cases.
customer_reviews.author: Jojo Mama

customer_reviews.title: Finally, an affordable storage solution
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is an ideal solution for storing guitars in their cases -- and avoid damaging your walls. Not likely built for everyday studio use, but ideal for the home. Who has time to design and build a custom stand in your gagrage? This is easy to assemble, almost immediatley ended complaints about having "too many guitars laying around."
customer_reviews.author: Gary Keffer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the money....utility is perfect and easy assembly
customer_reviews.author: Slick

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for: a beautifully made, sturdy product; incredibly simple to put together. I was displaying my cases in a matter of minutes. I will, no doubt, buy another.
customer_reviews.author: J. Crane

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: We got 6 guitars on this unit. It looks good and is sturdy. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: N M McG

customer_reviews.title: Elegant and functional
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful wood and well-designed piece. We are very happy with this purchase. Looks good and got the guitars off the couch.
customer_reviews.author: novice, but improving, player

customer_reviews.title: Great rack that holds both hardshell and softshell cases
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together and cleaned up my guitars stacked against the wall....would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hindman

customer_reviews.title: Just whatt I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, holds a lot of cases. Easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Walsingham

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful stand
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed with the quality of the wood. The stand is very minimalistic, but can hold 3 electric guitars, one acoustic guitar, one bass, and a banjo.
customer_reviews.author: TAC

customer_reviews.title: Off the floor
customer_reviews.text: This product is the full deal. Inexpensive, quality design, easy to assemble and American made. Everything I was looking for. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: viles

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my husband for his guitars. Looks great, easy set up and does the job nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen O. Leo

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Perfect for my home studio... and easy to assemble. If I could do it anyone could!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan the Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Holds five guitar cases, two acoustic, two classical and one electric. Very easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, classy, neat
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a sturdy rack for my instruments cases that would be easy to assemble and I'm glad to say that this is it! The wood grain is beautiful as well, very happy with this purchase! Helps to keep my music room tidy.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful & Practical
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, easy to assemble and very attractive price of furniture. And, I love that it’s made in the USA!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy S

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. Looks beautiful in my living room.

customer_reviews.title: Guitar Case Stand
customer_reviews.text: This actually works great. I finally got my guitars off the floor! For $69 it’s A+

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: very nice guitar rack--easy to assemble, and a great value

customer_reviews.title: Great guitar storage
customer_reviews.text: These are great to hold all your guitars in cases. 5-6 per stand with no wobble and in minimal space.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value and looks great
customer_reviews.text: This rack is well worth the money. It is sturdy and durable. My husband loves it. Holds his 4 bass guitar cases with room left over.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Hodges

customer_reviews.title: Good for cost, not hard to assemble but can be p.i.t.a
customer_reviews.text: Simple solution and good value for money but could be improved with small upgrades like rubber bushings or locking caster option.
customer_reviews.author: Jon S

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really nice, holds 5 or six of my instrument cases.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Harper

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together. Great quality! Holds all our guitars in their cases. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Spoon

customer_reviews.title: Form and function come together
customer_reviews.text: The wood is beautiful! It holds several instruments, but does not take over the room. It was easy to assemble. I would definitely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. It did exactly what I wanted and is well built with easy instructions.

product_meta.title: String Swing CC29 Folding Hardwood Guitar Case Rack
product_meta.description:
Size:5 Case Rack| Color:OakNOT YOUR “TYPICAL” GUITAR CASE RACK 

STRING SWING GUITAR CASE RACKS are CERTIFIED 100% MADE IN USA with REAL AMERICAN HARDWOOD and backed by a LIFETIME STRUCTURAL WARRANTY, all that to provide maximum structural integrity and safety, so no matter if you are playing your instruments or not, they are always in the “right hands” 

No matter what kind of guitar that you have, you can count on us to keep it safely stored, we have been crafting the best musical-instrument hangers and display systems that you can buy for OVER 30 YEARS; Our products are manufactured in Wisconsin, where we started, and are guaranteed for life 

Get your STRING SWING GUITAR HANGERS and keep your guitar safely stored; Add to cart Now while supplies last!
feature_bullets: Furniture Quality Acoustic and Electric Guitar Case rack your will look great in your studio, family room, study or great room.
Made in Wisconsin from responsibly harvested local Oak hardwood.
Quick assembly with only a screwdriver and lasts a lifetime. 30" x 36" x 13.25"
Folds flat for travel or storage
Backed by a lifetime structural warranty
